metadata.titleEn: Processed global tree-ring width data and codes for "Global tree growth resilience to cold extremes following the Tambora volcanic eruption"
metadata.titleCn: Processed global tree-ring width data and codes for "Global tree growth resilience to cold extremes following the Tambora volcanic eruption"
metadata.description: Although the global climate is warming, external forcing driven by explosive volcanic eruptions may still cause abrupt cooling. Herein, we investigated the magnitude of forest resilience shifts and their recovery time to the strong and lasting volcanic cooling after the 1809 and 1815 Tambora eruptions using 3304 tree-ring width chronologies across the globe. Global raw tree-ring width chronologies were collected from 3 sources, the International Tree-Ring Data Bank (ITRDB), the GenTree dendroecological collectionand the collection from the tree-ring group of the Institute of Tibetan Plateau Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences (ITPCAS).  We transformed the raw tree-ring width data (RW) into ring-width indices (RWI) by removing long-term trends caused by aging and increasing trunk diameter.  Since the continuous two major eruptions were recorded to have long-term effects on ecosystems, we used the most conservative standardization technique of fitting negative exponential curves to detrend tree-level series using the dplR package in R. Site-level, standard chronologies of RWI were averaged using a bi-weight robust mean. A 30-year cubic smoothing spline was also used to detrend for checking the stability of the influence time of volcanic forcing on tree growth.

background: The 1809 and 1815 Tambora eruptions caused lasting cold extremes worldwide, providing a unique lens that allows us to investigate the magnitude of global forest resilience to and recovery from volcanic cooling. Large volcanic eruptions are among the few natural phenomena that can force changes in the Earth’s climate system. The injection of sulfate aerosols can lead to a significant decrease in surface insolation and cause abrupt cooling at regional to global scales. This cooling effect also dampens the global hydrological cycle and increases the likelihood of subsequent El Niño events, causing anomalously dry conditions across the monsoon regions. Such extreme climate events severely impact forest resilience, reduce the provision of ecosystem services, and can even lead to societal collapses. The Mt. Tambora eruption in April 1815 was the largest explosive volcanic eruption recorded since AD 1400. The two eruptions together made the 1810s the coldest decade during the past 500 years. Tree-ring width variability is also a direct indicator of ecological responses and resilience to such extreme events.
research objective: In this study, we assessed: (i) to what extent and (ii) for how long cooling after the 1809 and 1815 eruptions affected tree growth resilience using global tree-ring width data.
methods: We further applied superposed epoch analysis (SEA) to explore the timing and significance of growth departures from pre-eruption growth levels.
dataset: Global raw tree-ring width chronologies were collected from three sources, the International Tree-Ring Data Bank (ITRDB), the GenTree dendroecological collection, and the collection from the tree-ring group of the Institute of Tibetan Plateau Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences (ITPCAS).
findings: The probability of growth extremes even increased up to more than tenfold in boreal and alpine forests. Growth reductions were most severe (reduced by 31.8%) in the Russian Arctic. Growth stability was substantially reduced (42.0%) in the Southwestern US from 1815 to 1822 compared to the pre-eruption 10 years. Growth stability was also significantly reduced in the Russian Arctic, for larch forests in western and central Europe, for conifers along the west coast of the U.S. and in eastern North America, and for deciduous broadleaves (Nothofagus) in the southern Andes. By contrast, for evergreen needleleaf forests in northern Europe, in the Mediterranean region, and in New Zealand, as well as for deciduous broadleaf forests in western and central Europe, the growth stability significantly increased. A significant and continuous decrease in growth resilience occurred either just after the eruption (1809) year or up to 3 years later. The longest influence times (over the year 1824) were found in the Mongolian and Tibetan Plateaus, the west coast of the US, mountainous regions of the Southwestern US, and central North America.
backgroundCn: 1809年和1815年的坦博拉火山喷发导致全球范围内持续的寒冷极端天气，为我们提供了一个独特的视角，以调查全球森林对火山冷却的韧性和恢复能力。大型火山喷发是少数能够强迫地球气候系统发生变化的自然现象之一。硫酸盐气溶胶的释放可以导致地表辐射强度显著下降，并在区域到全球范围内引起突发降温。这种降温效应还会抑制全球水文循环，并增加随后的厄尔尼诺事件的可能性，导致季风地区异常干燥的条件。这种极端气候事件严重影响森林的韧性，减少生态系统服务的提供，甚至可能导致社会崩溃。1815年4月的坦博拉火山喷发是自公元1400年以来记录的最大爆炸性火山喷发。这两次喷发使得1810年代成为过去500年中最寒冷的十年。树木年轮宽度的变化也是生态响应和对这种极端事件韧性的直接指标。
research objectiveCn: 在这项研究中，我们评估了：(i) 冷却在多大程度上影响了树木生长的恢复力，以及 (ii) 在多长时间内这种影响持续存在，使用了全球树木年轮宽度数据。
methodsCn: 我们进一步应用叠加历元分析（SEA）来探讨与喷发前生长水平的偏离的时机和重要性。
datasetCn: 全球原始树轮宽度年表数据来自三个来源：国际树轮数据银行（ITRDB）、GenTree树木生态学收藏以及中国科学院西藏高原研究所树轮组的收藏（ITPCAS）。
findingsCn: 在北方和高山森林中，极端生长的概率增加了十倍以上。俄罗斯北极地区的生长减少最为严重，减少了31.8%。与喷发前的10年相比，西南美国的生长稳定性显著降低了42.0%。俄罗斯北极地区、西欧的落叶松森林、美国西海岸的针叶树以及北美东部的针叶树和南安第斯的落叶阔叶树（南方红木）也显著降低了生长稳定性。相比之下，北欧的常绿针叶林、地中海地区和新西兰的常绿针叶林，以及西欧和中欧的落叶阔叶林的生长稳定性显著提高。生长韧性的显著且持续的下降发生在喷发（1809年）后或最多在3年内。影响时间最长的地区（超过1824年）包括蒙古和西藏高原、美国西海岸、西南美国的山区以及北美中部。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to assess tree growth resilience to volcanic cooling events?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于评估树木对火山冷却事件的生长韧性的资料收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a data collection method used to assess tree growth resilience is the collection of global raw tree-ring width chronologies from sources like the International Tree-Ring Data Bank (ITRDB), the GenTree dendroecological collection, and the collection from the tree-ring group of the Institute of Tibetan Plateau Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences (ITPCAS).
Example.AnswerCn: 评估树木生长韧性的一种数据收集方法是收集来自国际树轮数据银行（ITRDB）、GenTree树木生态学收藏以及中国科学院西藏高原研究所（ITPCAS）树轮组的全球原始树轮宽度年表。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a specific dataset that might be used to explore the impact of volcanic eruptions on tree growth?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个具体的数据集示例，用于探讨火山喷发对树木生长的影响？
Example.AnswerEn: A specific dataset that could be used to explore the impact of volcanic eruptions on tree growth includes the global raw tree-ring width chronologies collected from the International Tree-Ring Data Bank (ITRDB), the GenTree dendroecological collection, and the collection from the tree-ring group of the Institute of Tibetan Plateau Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences (ITPCAS).
Example.AnswerCn: 一个可以用来探索火山喷发对树木生长影响的特定数据集包括来自国际树轮数据银行（ITRDB）的全球原始树轮宽度年表、GenTree树木生态学收藏，以及中国科学院西藏高原研究所（ITPCAS）树轮组的收藏。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a method used to process raw tree-ring width data for analyzing tree growth resilience?
Example.QuestionCn: 用于分析树木生长韧性的原始树轮宽度数据处理方法的一个例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a method used to process raw tree-ring width data is transforming the raw data into ring-width indices (RWI) by removing long-term trends caused by aging and increasing trunk diameter using techniques such as fitting negative exponential curves and applying a 30-year cubic smoothing spline.
Example.AnswerCn: 处理原始树轮宽度数据的一种方法是将原始数据转化为环宽指数（RWI），通过去除因树龄和树干直径增加而导致的长期趋势，使用诸如拟合负指数曲线和应用30年立方平滑样条等技术。

Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 树轮宽度数据的特征使其适合用于分析历史气候事件，包括以下几点：

Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 生长变异性、随时间恢复、生态响应的指标、对极端气候事件的恢复力

Feature Specification.AnswerEn: negative exponential curves, 30-year cubic smoothing spline
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 负指数曲线，30年三次平滑样条

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data processing between using negative exponential curves and a 30-year cubic smoothing spline for detrending raw tree-ring width data?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用负指数曲线和30年立方平滑样条对原始树轮宽度数据进行去趋势处理之间的数据处理差异是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Negative exponential curves and 30-year cubic smoothing splines are both used for detrending tree-ring width data. The negative exponential curve is a conservative standardization technique that removes long-term trends caused by aging and increasing trunk diameter, whereas the 30-year cubic smoothing spline is used to check the stability of the influence time of volcanic forcing on tree growth. The choice between the two may affect the interpretation of growth resilience and stability.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 负指数曲线和30年立方平滑样条都用于去趋势树轮宽度数据。负指数曲线是一种保守的标准化技术，去除了由于树龄和树干直径增加引起的长期趋势，而30年立方平滑样条则用于检查火山强迫对树木生长影响的稳定性。这两者之间的选择可能会影响对生长韧性和稳定性的解释。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the application of superposed epoch analysis (SEA) compare to traditional methods in assessing the timing and significance of growth departures in tree-ring chronologies?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 超叠加纪元分析（SEA）在评估树轮年表中生长偏离的时机和显著性方面，与传统方法相比，有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Superposed epoch analysis (SEA) is specifically applied to explore the timing and significance of growth departures from pre-eruption levels, offering a way to align tree-ring data relative to significant events, such as volcanic eruptions. Traditional methods may not focus as directly on the temporal alignment of events, potentially leading to different insights into growth departures and resilience.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 叠加历元分析（SEA）专门用于探索生长偏离喷发前水平的时机和重要性，提供了一种将树轮数据与重大事件（如火山喷发）对齐的方法。传统方法可能没有那么直接关注事件的时间对齐，可能导致对生长偏离和恢复力的不同见解。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it important to transform raw tree-ring width data into ring-width indices (RWI) in studies examining the impact of volcanic eruptions on tree growth?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在研究火山喷发对树木生长影响时，将原始树轮宽度数据转化为环宽指数（RWI）是重要的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Transforming raw tree-ring width data into RWI is crucial to remove long-term trends caused by aging and trunk diameter increase. This standardization enables researchers to accurately assess the resilience and recovery of tree growth following volcanic eruptions by isolating the effects of the eruptions from other growth factors.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 将原始树轮宽度数据转化为相对树轮宽度（RWI）是至关重要的，这样可以消除由于树木老化和树干直径增加所导致的长期趋势。这种标准化使研究人员能够准确评估树木在火山喷发后生长的韧性和恢复能力，通过将喷发的影响与其他生长因素隔离开来。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of using superposed epoch analysis (SEA) on global tree-ring width data in studying the effects of volcanic eruptions on forest resilience?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用叠加历元分析（SEA）对全球树轮宽度数据进行研究火山喷发对森林恢复力影响的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Applying superposed epoch analysis (SEA) can reveal the timing and significance of growth departures from pre-eruption growth levels, helping to assess the extent and duration of volcanic cooling impacts on tree growth resilience.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 应用叠加历元分析（SEA）可以揭示树木生长在火山喷发前的生长水平的偏离时间和重要性，从而帮助评估火山冷却对树木生长韧性的影响程度和持续时间。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the integration of multiple sources, such as the International Tree-Ring Data Bank and GenTree dendroecological collection, affect the reliability and robustness of global tree-ring width datasets?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 多个来源的整合，例如国际树轮数据银行和GenTree树木生态学收藏，可能会如何影响全球树轮宽度数据集的可靠性和稳健性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating multiple sources can enhance the reliability and robustness of datasets by providing a comprehensive view of global tree-ring width chronologies, thus allowing for a more detailed analysis of tree growth resilience to volcanic cooling events.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合多个来源可以增强数据集的可靠性和稳健性，通过提供全球树轮宽度年表的全面视图，从而允许对树木生长对火山冷却事件的韧性进行更详细的分析。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to transform raw tree-ring width data into ring-width indices when investigating forest resilience to volcanic eruptions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在研究森林对火山喷发的恢复力时，将原始树轮宽度数据转化为环宽指数是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Transforming raw tree-ring width data into ring-width indices is crucial to remove long-term trends caused by aging and increasing trunk diameter, which allows researchers to focus on the short-term responses and resilience of trees to volcanic cooling events.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 将原始树轮宽度数据转化为环宽指数是至关重要的，这样可以消除由于树龄和树干直径增加所导致的长期趋势，从而使研究人员能够专注于树木对火山冷却事件的短期反应和恢复力。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods can be applied to transform raw tree-ring width data into indices that account for aging and increasing trunk diameter?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 可以应用哪些方法将原始树轮宽度数据转化为考虑到树龄和树干直径增加的指数？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: In this field, raw tree-ring width data is transformed into ring-width indices by removing long-term trends caused by aging and increasing trunk diameter. This is achieved by fitting negative exponential curves to detrend tree-level series using the dplR package in R. A 30-year cubic smoothing spline is also applied to check the stability of the influence time of volcanic forcing on tree growth.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在这个领域，原始的树轮宽度数据通过去除因树龄和树干直径增加而导致的长期趋势，转化为环宽指数。这是通过使用R语言中的dplR包对树木级别的系列拟合负指数曲线来实现的。同时，应用30年的三次平滑样条，以检查火山强迫对树木生长影响的稳定性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can superposed epoch analysis (SEA) be utilized to determine the timing and significance of growth departures from pre-eruption levels in tree-ring data?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 超级叠加历元分析（SEA）如何用于确定树轮数据中生长偏离喷发前水平的时机和重要性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Superposed epoch analysis (SEA) is applied to explore the timing and significance of growth departures from pre-eruption growth levels, allowing researchers to assess the impact of volcanic eruptions on tree growth resilience.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 叠加历元分析（SEA）被应用于探索与喷发前生长水平的偏离时间和显著性，使研究人员能够评估火山喷发对树木生长韧性的影响。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in collecting global raw tree-ring width data from various sources for analysis in dendroecological studies?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在树木生态学研究中，收集全球原始树轮宽度数据的程序涉及以下步骤：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Global raw tree-ring width chronologies are collected from sources such as the International Tree-Ring Data Bank (ITRDB), the GenTree dendroecological collection, and the collection from the tree-ring group of the Institute of Tibetan Plateau Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences (ITPCAS) to facilitate analysis in dendroecological studies.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 全球原始树轮宽度年表数据来自国际树轮数据银行（ITRDB）、GenTree树木生态学收藏以及中国科学院西藏高原研究所树轮组的收藏，以便于在树轮生态学研究中的分析。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methods enable the accurate assessment of tree growth resilience to historical volcanic eruptions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集方法能够准确评估树木对历史火山喷发的生长韧性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Accurate assessment of tree growth resilience to historical volcanic eruptions is enabled by collecting global raw tree-ring width chronologies from diverse sources like the International Tree-Ring Data Bank (ITRDB), the GenTree dendroecological collection, and the collection from the tree-ring group of the Institute of Tibetan Plateau Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences (ITPCAS). This data is then transformed into ring-width indices (RWI) by removing long-term trends due to aging and increased trunk diameter.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 通过收集来自国际树轮数据银行（ITRDB）、GenTree树木生态学收藏以及中国科学院西藏高原研究所树轮组的收藏（ITPCAS）的全球原始树轮宽度年表，可以准确评估树木对历史火山喷发的生长韧性。然后，通过去除由于老化和树干直径增加造成的长期趋势，将这些数据转化为年轮宽度指数（RWI）。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways does the use of bi-weight robust mean and cubic smoothing spline contribute to the stability and reliability of tree growth data analysis?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 使用双权重稳健均值和三次平滑样条在树木生长数据分析中如何有助于稳定性和可靠性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of a bi-weight robust mean contributes to the stability and reliability of tree growth data analysis by averaging site-level, standard chronologies of ring-width indices (RWI), while a 30-year cubic smoothing spline is applied to detrend data, checking the stability of the influence time of volcanic forcing on tree growth.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用双权重稳健均值有助于通过对树木生长数据分析的稳定性和可靠性，平均站点水平的年轮宽度指数（RWI）标准年表，同时应用30年的三次平滑样条对数据进行去趋势处理，以检查火山强迫对树木生长影响时间的稳定性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection methods for tree-ring width chronologies from different global sources potentially lead to variations in the data quality or consistency?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 不同全球来源的树轮宽度年表的数据收集方法可能导致数据质量或一致性差异的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Global raw tree-ring width chronologies were collected from three different sources, which could potentially lead to variations in data quality or consistency due to differences in collection methods, regional climate influences, and calibration techniques used by each source.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 全球原始树轮宽度年表来自三个不同的来源，这可能导致数据质量或一致性方面的差异，因为每个来源在收集方法、区域气候影响和校准技术上存在不同。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might certain regions, such as the Mongolian and Tibetan Plateaus, experience longer influence times of volcanic eruptions on tree growth compared to other areas?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 某些地区，如蒙古高原和青藏高原，可能会经历火山喷发对树木生长的影响时间更长的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The longest influence times were observed in regions like the Mongolian and Tibetan Plateaus, possibly due to their specific climatic and environmental conditions, which could lead to prolonged cooling effects and ecological responses to volcanic aerosols.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 最长的影响时间出现在蒙古和西藏高原等地区，这可能与它们特定的气候和环境条件有关，这些条件可能导致火山气溶胶引起的持续降温效应和生态响应。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the effectiveness of using superposed epoch analysis (SEA) to assess the impact of volcanic eruptions on tree growth resilience?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您对使用叠加历元分析（SEA）评估火山喷发对树木生长韧性的影响的有效性有何评价？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of superposed epoch analysis (SEA) is effective in exploring the timing and significance of growth departures from pre-eruption growth levels, allowing researchers to assess the extent and duration of cooling effects on tree growth resilience after major volcanic eruptions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 叠加历元分析（SEA）的使用在探索树木生长偏离喷发前生长水平的时机和重要性方面是有效的，使研究人员能够评估主要火山喷发后树木生长韧性降温效应的程度和持续时间。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you judge the challenges involved in collecting global raw tree-ring width chronologies from diverse sources, and what impact do these challenges have on data consistency?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何评估从不同来源收集全球原始树轮宽度年表所面临的挑战，这些挑战对数据一致性产生了什么影响？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Collecting global raw tree-ring width chronologies from multiple sources, such as the International Tree-Ring Data Bank (ITRDB), GenTree dendroecological collection, and ITPCAS, presents challenges in ensuring data consistency and comparability. These challenges can affect the overall accuracy and reliability of the assessments regarding tree growth resilience to cold extremes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 从多个来源收集全球原始树轮宽度年表，如国际树轮数据银行（ITRDB）、GenTree树木生态学收藏和ITPCAS，面临确保数据一致性和可比性的挑战。这些挑战可能影响关于树木生长对寒冷极端天气的韧性评估的整体准确性和可靠性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, how well does the transformation of raw tree-ring width data into ring-width indices (RWI) address long-term trends caused by aging and increasing trunk diameter?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在您看来，将原始树轮宽度数据转化为环宽指数（RWI）在多大程度上解决了由于树龄增长和树干直径增加而导致的长期趋势？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The transformation of raw tree-ring width data into ring-width indices (RWI) effectively addresses long-term trends caused by aging and increasing trunk diameter by removing these trends, allowing for a more accurate assessment of tree growth responses to short-term climatic events like volcanic eruptions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 将原始年轮宽度数据转化为年轮宽度指数（RWI）有效地解决了由于树木老化和树干直径增加所导致的长期趋势，通过去除这些趋势，使得对树木生长对短期气候事件（如火山喷发）的响应进行更准确的评估。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods can effectively capture tree growth resilience following volcanic eruptions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何有效捕捉火山喷发后树木生长的韧性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Global raw tree-ring width chronologies are collected from sources like the International Tree-Ring Data Bank (ITRDB), the GenTree dendroecological collection, and the tree-ring group of the Institute of Tibetan Plateau Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences (ITPCAS). These sources provide data that can be transformed into ring-width indices (RWI) by removing long-term trends to study tree growth resilience post-eruptions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 全球原始年轮宽度年表数据来自国际年轮数据银行（ITRDB）、GenTree树木生态学收藏以及中国科学院西藏高原研究所的树轮组（ITPCAS）。这些来源提供的数据可以通过去除长期趋势转化为年轮宽度指数（RWI），以研究树木在火山喷发后生长的韧性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how the existing datasets can be expanded or refined to better understand the long-term effects of volcanic cooling on forest ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解现有数据集如何扩展或细化，以更好地了解火山冷却对森林生态系统的长期影响。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The datasets can be refined by applying methodologies like superposed epoch analysis (SEA) to explore growth departures over time, and by using different detrending techniques like negative exponential curves and cubic smoothing splines. Such approaches help in assessing the timing and significance of growth changes and can potentially extend the dataset's applicability to broader ecological studies.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据集可以通过应用超叠加历元分析（SEA）等方法进行精炼，以探索随时间变化的生长偏离，并通过使用不同的去趋势技术，如负指数曲线和三次平滑样条。这些方法有助于评估生长变化的时机和重要性，并可能扩展数据集在更广泛生态研究中的适用性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the potential challenges faced in the collection and transformation of global tree-ring width data into ring-width indices.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在全球树轮宽度数据的收集和转化为年轮宽度指数过程中可能面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The transformation of raw tree-ring width data into ring-width indices involves removing long-term trends caused by aging and trunk diameter increase. A conservative standardization technique using negative exponential curves is applied, and a bi-weight robust mean is used to average site-level chronologies. Additionally, a 30-year cubic smoothing spline is used to ensure the stability of volcanic influence on tree growth.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 将原始年轮宽度数据转化为年轮宽度指数涉及去除因树木老化和树干直径增加而导致的长期趋势。采用保守的标准化技术，使用负指数曲线进行处理，并使用双权重稳健均值对站点级年轮序列进行平均。此外，使用30年的三次平滑样条以确保火山对树木生长的影响的稳定性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please investigate different data collection methods used for acquiring global tree-ring width chronologies and how they contribute to understanding forest resilience to volcanic eruptions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请调查用于获取全球树轮宽度年表的不同数据收集方法，以及它们如何有助于理解森林对火山喷发的恢复力。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Global tree-ring width chronologies are collected from the International Tree-Ring Data Bank (ITRDB), the GenTree dendroecological collection, and the collection from the tree-ring group of the Institute of Tibetan Plateau Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences (ITPCAS). These sources provide comprehensive global datasets that help analyze the impact of volcanic eruptions on forest resilience by examining tree growth variability.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 全球树轮宽度年表数据来自国际树轮数据银行（ITRDB）、GenTree树木生态学收藏以及中国科学院西藏高原研究所树轮组的收藏（ITPCAS）。这些来源提供了全面的全球数据集，帮助通过研究树木生长变异性来分析火山喷发对森林恢复力的影响。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please conduct an analysis of the methodological approaches used in assessing the influence time of volcanic forcing on tree growth using tree-ring data.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请对使用树轮数据评估火山强迫对树木生长影响的研究方法进行分析。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The methodological approach involves transforming raw tree-ring width data into indices and using conservative detrending techniques to analyze growth resilience. Superposed epoch analysis (SEA) is applied to explore growth departures from pre-eruption levels, while the use of a 30-year cubic smoothing spline helps determine the stability of volcanic influence on tree growth.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 该方法论涉及将原始树轮宽度数据转化为指数，并使用保守的去趋势技术来分析生长韧性。采用叠加纪元分析（SEA）来探讨生长偏离喷发前水平的情况，同时使用30年立方平滑样条来帮助确定火山对树木生长影响的稳定性。
